s.text: And since allergies rarely shorten life spans or discourage mates, it is unlikely natural selection will ever weed them out.
And in rare cases, allergic attacks can turn into anaphylaxis , where toxic levels of histamines and other chemicals are released, causing asphyxiation, vomiting, and death.
Also, lack of winter freezes means that mites normally killed off by the cold will survive.
Other common allergies include reactions to the proteins found in food , the excrement of mites , and the saliva of
(Other useful pollen tips: During the summer, pollen counts tend to be lower before 8 a.m., after dark, and following rain.)

With one afflicted parent, there is a 50 percent chance of inheritance; and when neither parent is an allergy sufferer, there's still a 20 percent chance.
